title: Chinese Government provides second batch of medical supplies to the Ukrainian Government in June 2020 (Linked to Project ID #93904)
description: On June 8, 2020, the Chinese Government provided 50,016 COVID-19 testing kits, 50,000 medical masks, 30,000 medical goggles, 1,000 thermometers, 200,000 surgical masks, 30,000 medical protective suits, and 50,000 disposable medical gloves to the Ukrainian Government. This donation was made to improve Ukraine’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  The supplies arrived in Kyiv and were accepted by Ukraine's state-owned vaccine company. It is unclear which entity this is. This donation is the second batch of humanitarian medical supplies donated by the Chinese Government. The first batch was delivered on April 1, 2020 and the details of this batch are captured in Project ID #93904.   Both of these donations stem from a meeting between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Chinese Ambassador Fan Xianrong. At this meeting, President Zelensky requested medical equipment and assistance from the Chinese government.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Embassy donates masks to fourth and ninth hospitals in Kyiv in March 2020
description: On March 31, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Ukraine donated medical masks to the Fourth and Ninth hospitals in Kyiv, Ukraine. These hospitals were dedicated to COVID-19 treatment in Kyiv. The masks will be distributed throughout the hospitals to improve COVID-19 prevention efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. China’s Ambassador to Ukraine, Fan Xianrong, attended the ceremony and delivered a speech.

title: Chinese Government donates first batch of COVID-19 medical supplies to the Ukrainian Ministry of Health in April 2020 (Linked to Project ID #93857)
description: On April 1, 2020, the Chinese Government donated the first batch of COVID-19 medical supplies to the Ukrainian Ministry of Health. The supplies included protective suits, surgical gloves, shoe covers, and infrared thermometers. This donation was made to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Ukraine. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   The supplies arrived at Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv, Ukraine where a handover ceremony was held. China’s Ambassador to Ukraine, Fan Xianrong, delivered the supplies to the Ukrainian Deputy Health Minister.   This is the first batch of COVID-19 supplies donated by the Chinese Government to Ukraine. The second batch arrived in Ukraine on July 8, 2020. The details of this donation are captured in Project ID #93857.
combined_text:

HEALTH

# Title

# Description

The supplies included protective suits, surgical gloves, shoe covers, and infrared thermometers. This donation was made to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Ukraine. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   The supplies arrived at Boryspil International Airport in Kyiv, Ukraine where a handover ceremony was held. China’s Ambassador to Ukraine, Fan Xianrong, delivered the supplies to the Ukrainian Deputy Health Minister.   This is the first batch of COVID-19 supplies donated by the Chinese Government to Ukraine. The second batch arrived in Ukraine on July 8, 2020. The details of this donation are captured in Project ID #93857.

title: Chinese Government donates anti-epidemic materials to Donetsk, Ukraine in March 2020
description: On March 26, 2020, the Chinese Government donated anti-epidemic materials to Donetsk, a city in Ukraine. The materials included 5,000 test kits, 18 laboratory tests, 900 respirators, and 430 medical protective gowns. The delivery of this donation was announced by the head of the Donetsk Regional State Administration, Pavlo Kyrylenko. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  Following the donation, the Donetsk Regional State Administration carried out the distribution of these materials. 800 respirators were handed over to the National Police, 10 to the Donetsk Regional AIDS Prevention and Control Center, and 90 respirators were left in reserve. Dressing gowns were transferred directly to medical facilities, the regional center for medical assistance, the Center for HIV Prevention and Control, and the Donetsk Regional Laboratory Center. The test kits were distributed to infectious diseases hospitals throughout the region.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates anti-epidemic materials to Donetsk, Ukraine in March 2020

# Description
On March 26, 2020, the Chinese Government donated anti-epidemic materials to Donetsk, a city in Ukraine. The materials included 5,000 test kits, 18 laboratory tests, 900 respirators, and 430 medical protective gowns. The delivery of this donation was announced by the head of the Donetsk Regional State Administration, Pavlo Kyrylenko. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  Following the donation, the Donetsk Regional State Administration carried out the distribution of these materials. 800 respirators were handed over to the National Police, 10 to the Donetsk Regional AIDS Prevention and Control Center, and 90 respirators were left in reserve. Dressing gowns were transferred directly to medical facilities, the regional center for medical assistance, the Center for HIV Prevention and Control, and the Donetsk Regional Laboratory Center. The test kits were distributed to infectious diseases hospitals throughout the region.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare and epidemic prevention, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of medical supplies including test kits, respirators, and protective gowns for epidemic prevention

title: Guangzhou Municipal Government donates anti-epidemic materials to Kyiv in August 2020
description: On August 10, 2020, the Chinese city of Guangzhou provided 100,000 disposable medical masks and 200 infrared thermometers to Kyiv, Ukraine. These materials will be used to improve COVID-19 response efforts in Ukraine. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  Following the delivery of this donation, the Kyiv City State Administration handled the distribution of the supplies. The thermometers were distributed to boarding schools and social facilities throughout Kyiv while the donated masks were provided to social workers.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Xiangtan Municipal Government donates COVID-19 materials to Lutsk, Ukraine in August 2020
description: On August 5, 2020, the Chinese city of Xiangtan provided COVID-19 materials to the Executive Committee of the Lutsk City Council. The donated materials included 4,400 disposable masks, 500 N95 respirators, and 50 sets of single-use clothing. This donation was completed within the framework of a cooperation between Lutsk and Xiangtan that was signed in 2003. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  Following the donation, these materials were distributed to staff at the Lutsk City Clinical Hospital.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese Government donates COVID-19 response materials to Ukraine in June 2020
description: On June 24, 2020, the Chinese government provided 125 cubic meters of COVID-19 response materials to Ukraine. The materials arrived on an Ukrainian Armed Forces aircraft in Kyiv, the capital city of Ukraine. The donated materials consisted of more than one million masks, respirators, protective suits, goggles, screens, gloves, infrared thermometers, testing systems for COVID-19, disinfectants, and antiseptics. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at Boryspil International Airport. Fan Xianrong, the Chinese Ambassador to Ukraine, attended the ceremony along with Ukrainian Deputy Foreign Minister Ye Ning and Deputy Health Minister Ivanchenko.  The Ukrainian Ministry of Health coordinated the distribution of these donated materials. Following the handover ceremony, 32,000 of the donated masks were given to the Ukrainian Ministry of Foreign Affairs to help make the work of the Ministry more efficient during the quarantine period.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates COVID-19 response materials to Ukraine in June 2020

# Description
On June 24, 2020, the Chinese government provided 125 cubic meters of COVID-19 response materials to Ukraine. The materials arrived on an Ukrainian Armed Forces aircraft in Kyiv, the capital city of Ukraine. The donated materials consisted of more than one million masks, respirators, protective suits, goggles, screens, gloves, infrared thermometers, testing systems for COVID-19, disinfectants, and antiseptics. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at Boryspil International Airport. Fan Xianrong, the Chinese Ambassador to Ukraine, attended the ceremony along with Ukrainian Deputy Foreign Minister Ye Ning and Deputy Health Minister Ivanchenko.  The Ukrainian Ministry of Health coordinated the distribution of these donated materials. Following the handover ceremony, 32,000 of the donated masks were given to the Ukrainian Ministry of Foreign Affairs to help make the work of the Ministry more efficient during the quarantine period.
justification: Project is a humanitarian donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: COVID-19 response materials including masks, protective equipment, and testing systems; coordinated by health ministry

title: Jiangxi Province donates COVID-19 materials to Ukraine in April 2020
description: On April 11, 2020, the Jiangxi Province of China donated COVID-19 materials to Ukraine. This donation is part of the long-term Ukraine-China Air Bridge project. The Department of External Relations of Jiangxi Province sponsored the handover of these materials. The specific type, amount, and monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: Ukraine and China sign exchange of letters for donation of conference equipment to Ukraine in December 2020
description: On December 9, 2020, the Chinese Government and Ukrainian Government signed an exchange of letters for the approval of China’s donation of conference system equipment to the Ukrainian Ministry of Economic Development, Trade and Agriculture. The Ukrainian Minister of Economic Development, Trade and Agriculture, Petrashko Ihor Rostislavovych, signed the agreement on behalf of Ukraine. The monetary value and implementation details for this donation are unavailable.

title: Ningbo Municipal Government donates 10,000 masks to Odessa, Ukraine in September 2020
description: On September 22, 2020, the Red Cross Society of Odessa Oblast handed over 10,000 protective masks donated by Ningbo Municipal Government to the Odessa city government. Odessa has a long-standing relationship with Ningbo, including a variety of academic and governmental visits over the past decade. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
